p: Synthesis of 1,3-dimethylimidazolium chloride ( 1) [ 35]. In a 250 mL round bottom flask immersed in an ice bath, 10 g of 1-methylimidazole was placed, and 10 mL of HCl (37% aqueous solution) was slowly added. After 20 min, the solvent was evaporated to yield the desired ionic liquid, 1-methylimidazolium chloride, to be used in the following step without further purification. In a Q-tube reactor, 3.0 g of 1-methylimidazolium chloride and 2.28 g of dimethyl carbonate (DMC; 0.025 mmol) were placed, and the mixture was heated at 170 °C for two hours to yield the desired product, 1,3-dimethyl imidazolium chloride 1, in quantitative yield. 1H-NMR (200 MHz, DMSO- d 6, ppm): δ = 9.46 (s, 1H), 7.87 (s, 2H), 3.87 (m, 6H).
